pr_title: filter out exceptions which should not be counted in failure stats

timeline.message: filter out exceptions which should not be counted in failure stats

timeline.bodyText: This error checking is too general. I will change this part in next commit. My plan is to list all of supported aggregation types, check if the feature aggregation supported before starting detector.
timeline.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText: FYI: We can also get RemoteTransportException with nestedd java.lang.IllegalArgumentException.  See tt V279686544 for detail.
replies.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: Yeah, it's hard to cover all exceptions correctly. So I will update this part soon and publish a new commit.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText:
FYI: We can also get RemoteTransportException with nestedd java.lang.IllegalArgumentException. See tt V279686544 for detail.

Tested latest commit on odfe1.12, use sum on text  field, can see debug level remote transport exception, the error message is a little bit different, but actually it's wrapped into SearchPhaseExecutionException , so we can catch such exception and end detector run.
I see the issue you shared occurred on 7.4, so I backported the change to odfe1.4 and tested sum on message, can see RemoteTransportException and the same error stack. Actually the RemoteTransportException will be wrapped into SearchPhaseExecutionException and what we got in handleExecuteException method is SearchPhaseExecutionException.

replies.author: ylwu-amzn

timeline.author: yizheliu-amazon
yizheliu-amazon

replies.bodyText: This can be an error from us.  Can we count it?
replies.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: Sure, will count this error in failure stats.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

timeline.bodyText: do we have plan to migrate other IT to extend this ADIntegTestCase?
timeline.author: yizheliu-amazon

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I think it can save some effort to write IT cases with this ADIntegTestCase. Not urgent, we can write new IT cases by extending this class first. If we have bandwith, we can do some migration.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

timeline.bodyText: This can be a bug of us.  Can we count it in stats?
timeline.author: kaituo

timeline.bodyText: how about changing to "!(e instanceof AnomalyDetectionException) || ((AnomalyDetectionException) e).isCountInStats()"?  This is more effective than negative of negative.
timeline.author: kaituo

timeline.bodyText: This can be an error from us. Can we count it?
timeline.author: kaituo

timeline.bodyText: Do you plan to add the error message for the exception on kibana?  Users need to know why their detectors are stopped.   Also, we need to have some prefix before the concrete causes.  Kibana would need it to differentiate errors from the backend and provide suggested actions.
timeline.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: Good point, added invalid query tag.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText: Do you plan to add the error message for the exception on kibana?
replies.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: Kibana already supported invalid query tag. Have added this tag in backend exception message.
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

timeline.message: add invalid query tag so we can show error message on frontend
add invalid query tag so we can show error message on frontend

timeline.bodyText: if invalidQuery is false, do you want to return immediately?
timeline.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText: Also, how do you plan to deal with #341 (comment) ?
replies.author: kaituo

replies.bodyText:
Also, how do you plan to deal with #341 (comment) ?

Check this reply #341 (comment)
replies.author: ylwu-amzn

replies.bodyText:
if invalidQuery is false, do you want to return immediately?

Will return as InternalFailure
replies.author: ylwu-amzn
